org.grouplens.lenskit.eval.traintest

Class TrainTestEvalTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.common.util.concurrent.AbstractFuture<T>
      • org.grouplens.lenskit.eval.AbstractTask<Table>
        • org.grouplens.lenskit.eval.traintest.TrainTestEvalTask
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ListenableFuture<Table>, java.util.concurrent.Future<Table>, EvalTask<Table>

    public class TrainTestEvalTask
extends AbstractTask<Table>
    The command that run the algorithmInfo instance and output the prediction result file and the evaluation result file

      • setComponentCacheDirectory

        public TrainTestEvalTask setComponentCacheDirectory(java.io.File file)
        Set the component cache directory. This directory is used for caching components that might take a lot of memory but are shared between runs. Only meaningful if algorithms are not separated.
        Parameters:
        file - The cache directory.
        Returns:
        The task (for chaining)
        See Also:
        setSeparateAlgorithms(boolean)

      • getComponentCacheDirectory

        public java.io.File getComponentCacheDirectory()

      • setCacheAllComponents

        public TrainTestEvalTask setCacheAllComponents(boolean flag)
        Control whether all components are cached. Caching all components will use more disk space, but may allow future evaluations to re-use component instances from prior runs.
        Parameters:
        flag - true to cache all components.
        Returns:
        The task (for chaining).

      • getCacheAllComponents

        public boolean getCacheAllComponents()

      • setIsolate

        @Deprecated
public TrainTestEvalTask setIsolate(boolean iso)
        Deprecated. Isolate data sets instead.
        Control whether the train-test evaluator will isolate data sets. If set to true, then each data set will be run in turn, with no inter-data-set parallelism. This can reduce memory usage for some large runs, keeping the data from only a single data set in memory at a time. Otherwise (the default), individual algorithmInfo/data-set runs may be freely intermingled.
        Parameters:
        iso - Whether to isolate data sets.
        Returns:
        The task (for chaining).

      • setSeparateAlgorithms

        public TrainTestEvalTask setSeparateAlgorithms(boolean sep)
        Control whether the evaluator separates or combines algorithms. If set to true, each algorithm instance is built without reusing components from other algorithm instances. By default, LensKit will try to reuse common components between algorithm configurations (one downside of this is that it makes build timings meaningless).
        Parameters:
        sep - If true, separate algorithms.
        Returns:
        The task (for chaining).
